The world needs evidence of sincere Christianity. Spurious Christianity may be seen everywhere. When the power of God's grace is felt in our churches, the members will work the works of Christ. Their natural and hereditary traits of character will be transformed by the Spirit that dwelt in the greatest Minister that ever trod the soil of this fallen world. The indwelling of this Spirit will enable them to reveal Christ's likeness, and 


                                        -372- 

in proportion to the purity of their piety will be the success of their work.--Letter 54a, 1898, pp. 1, 3, 4. (To "The Ministers of Our Conferences," June, 1898.)
